Skills Recommended: Planning skills, Marketing, English, Fundraising, Project Management
Address Recommended: 17th floor, Block A, Song Da Building, Pham Hung Street, My Dinh 1 Ward, Nam Tu Liem District, HN
Job Requierements: Education:University degree or higher related to business and marketing. Work experience. ▪Experience in sales and developing products. ▪Experience in management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work. ▪Experience in leadership, management, interpersonal/social and multicultural understanding/sensitivity. ▪Good written and verbal communication skills. ▪Attention to detail and problemsolving skills. ▪Strong organizational and planning skills. ▪NGO working experience is preferable. Skills. ▪Ability to work independently and with the team. ▪Ability to work under pressure. ▪Good organizing skills and interpersonal skills. ▪Good skill in computer use: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Email. ▪Good at English, both verbally and in writing;Attitude. ▪Sociable, responsive, committed working with GNI at least 02 years. ▪Accountable and transparent. ▪Enthusiastic in work. ▪Teamwork. Interested Vietnamese candidates are invited to send their application (including a letter of motivation, a CV withsalary desiredand a portrait photo attached) to Human Resource Division via the email address or to the Head Office address: Good Neighbors International in Vietnam, 17th Floor, Block A, Song Da Building, My Dinh I, Nam Tu Liem, Hanoi no later than 17th October,2024. We are very sorry that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews.
Job Description: Main task. Participate, monitor, and support staff in division to implement activities for complying with GNI’s regulations, project’s quality, and progress. Be in charge of providing technical guidance to partners if needed to ensure the smooth and effectiveness of project implementation. Be in charge of preparing proposal and operating special projects for income generation, carry out fundraising activities for IG projects, income, microfinance, and potentials for economic development in current CDPs. Coordinate with the CDPs and research partners for value chain analysis, marketing for products of IG projects. Responsible for developing products at all CDPs. Responsible for managing working capital, status of use, disbursement, recovery, and preservation of capital. Be in charge of developing network and researching partners for value chain analysis, marketing for products of IG projects. Be in charge of Implementing business promotion through market researching, branding, value chain analyzing for products of IG project. Be in charge of finding, developing and raising products quality at CDPs. Supporting task. Participate in making strategies of GNV and IGD in accordance with GNI’s strategies. Participate and support staff in division and project managers in making plan of action (POA) of GNI and CDP. Participate in developing and maintaining regulations, guiding forms in implementation of project activities (IGG, HED, RF). Coordinate with partners in organizing meetings and workshops. Support IG team manager to evaluate and provide capacity building training to IG staff in HO and CDPs. Support IG team manager to monitor and manage IGD budget and ensure disbursement progress as regulated. Networking development. Develop network of experts, consultants, and service provider related IG activities. Establish and maintain good relationships with partners, community and donors. Reporting. Submit reports timely as requested (GIF, Director board, Manager, Donors…). Other Tasks. Participate in other GNV activities as meeting, fund raising program…. Contribute in building and developing the organization’s culture and reputation. Consult and assist the IG team manager in necessary cases. Implement other duties when requested by line managers. Other tasks if required.

Skills Recommended: NGO Field, Project Management, Procurement, Contract Management, System Administration
Address Recommended: Hà Nội, Việt Nam
Job Requierements: Required Qualifications. Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Information Technology, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. Additional certifications in Project Management, System Administration, or Procurement/Contract Management are a plus. Required Skills and Competencies. 35 years of experience in system administration. Experience in a nonprofit or INGO setting is preferred, particularly in roles involving system management or process coordination. Proven experience in working with crossfunctional teams (e.g., Finance, Procurement, IT) to implement, monitor, and optimize systems and workflows. Familiarity with system development and integration, including working with IT vendors to support system deployment. Experience in training development and delivery for systems and software tools, ideally related to finance, procurement, and contract management. Technical Skills: Familiarity with database management, report generation, and system troubleshooting. Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Vietnamese to coordinate across teams, provide training, and troubleshoot system issues. Identifies and aligns with the core values of the WWF organization: Courage, Collaboration, Respect & Integrity;. Adheres to WWF’s brand values: Knowledgeable, Optimistic, Determined and Engaging;. Demonstrates WWF behaviours in ways of working: strive for impact, listen deeply, collaborate openly and innovate fearlessly. Working Relationships:. Internal:Interact on a regular basis with : Fund raising team, Relevant Project Manager, Procurement and Contract team, Project Finance team and relevant project focal points,. External:Interacts with suppliers, consultants and field offices as required in fulfilment of duties. This job description covers the main tasks and conveys the spirit of the sort of tasks that are anticipated proactively from. Location:Based in Ha Noi.
Job Description: Background. WWF was one of the first International nongovernment organizations working in Vietnam. In 1985, WWF began working on a national conservation strategy and since then has worked closely with the Vietnamese Government on a diverse range of environment issues and implemented field activities across the country. Find out more at http://vietnam.panda.org/. WWF recognizes that its employees are its most important asset. A competent workforce, thoroughly trained, properly motivated, and bound together by mutual trust and common objectives is crucial to the success of WWF. II. Mission of the Department:. To ensure the effective management and control of WWFViet Nam and Greater Mekong (GM Hub) finances through the identification and management of financial and operational risk and through timely and accurate financial planning, budgeting, accounting and reporting, including compliance with Swiss GAAP requirements. To provide strategic advice/support to the WWFViet Nam Country Management Team (CMT). Leads the financial accounting and reporting activities for the office and sets the policies and procedures for the financerelated operational processes to ensure an adequate financial control environment. Ensures strong governance, control, oversight and stewardship are in place to enable risk management and mitigation. Manages the finance and operations aspects of general accounting function. III. Major Functions:. Under the direct supervision of the Finance Director, The Systems Development Senior Officer will manage and oversee all online system under Finance function including Grant Management System (GMS) , Procurement management system , Contract management system to ensure that all related information is efficiently captured and tracked. IV. Major Duties and Responsibilities:. The Systems development Senior Officer key roles and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:. 1. Grant Management System (GMS) Administration:. Oversee the Grant Management System (GMS), ensuring all project data is accurately entered and maintained, from project development to project completion. Assist Finance Director to ensure that the system is used effectively by all relevant stakeholders, tracking the progress, budgets, milestones, and outcomes of all grants. Support users with system navigation, troubleshooting, and ensuring the system is updated in realtime as project details evolve. Generate reports and dashboards from the GMS for senior management as requested. Act as Vietnam GMS champion in coordination with GMS International team. 2. Procurement Management System (PMS) Oversight:. Manage and regular upgrade the Procurement Management System (PMS), ensuring that purchase requests, procurement processes, and vendor management are handled efficiently and in compliance with organizational policies. Administer the system to track procurement requests, approvals, and status updates, and ensure compliance with procurement guidelines. Collaborate with the procurement team to address any systemrelated issues and work towards improving procurement workflows. Generate procurementrelated reports for senior management and provide recommendations for process improvements. 3. Contract Management System development and Oversight:. In collaboration with Procurement and Contract teams to define and streamline contract workflows, ensuring clarity in roles, responsibilities, and timelines for contract management process. Identify IT vendor to support the system development process. Coordinate all relevant stake holder including IT vendor and relevant functions to support Finance Director to ensure the smoothly developing, testing and launching of Contract Management System. Manage the Contract Management System to ensure contract information is accurately captured, stored, and easily accessible. Ensure timely updates and maintenance of contract data, tracking milestones, and critical dates. Assist in troubleshooting system issues, working with IT teams to resolve technical challenges. Generate reports and dashboards for stakeholders to monitor contract statuses and key performance metrics. 4. Training and others. Design and implement training sessions for staff on all system in charged on GMS, Procurement Management Systems and Contract Management System. Maintain an uptodate training repository and provide ongoing support to staff on system usage and best practices. Work closely with relevant team leaders to develop training materials on financerelated content. Assist Finance Director in coordinating relevant Finance department event and training. Others task as assigned by Finance Director

Company Name: Habitat For Humanity International In Vietnam
Skills Recommended: Market Research, Market Analysis
Address Recommended: Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam
Job Requierements: Minimum education. Bachelor’s degree in related field. Technical competencies. Minimum 3 years of experience of fundraising, marketing communications, communications, partnership and business development strongly preferred. Must have working knowledge of the local, national, regional and global trends. Must be familiar with regulations and needs concerning the INGO sector of Vietnam and able to apply with indepth knowledge and skills in fundraising in consideration of this context. Business competencies. Fluency in spoken and written English. Native language skills in Vietnamese. Excellent written and oral communication skills and translation skills required. Highly creative and resourceful, is selfleading, and able to coordinate multiple tasks. Good public speaking skills and presentation skills in Vietnamese and English languages. Selfmotivated, resultdriven, possesses a positive and proactive outlook, flexible and able to work independently and without close supervision and when under pressure, and an excellent team player. Able to work effectively in crosscultural settings; can support, negotiate and cooperate with those of other cultures. Creative and outgoing with excellent people skills and an upbeat and enthusiastic attitude. Excellent computer skills, Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel);. Graphics design (InDesign, Adobe Photoshop, etc) and photography skills are a plus. Knowledge in Movie Makers and web programs are a plus. Proven experience using social media tools (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube) to energize interactions and mobilized increased presence and following. Work styles. Leading and Communicating. Collaborating and Partnering. Managing Quality Service,. Flexible and creative in crisis management. Fully clientand serviceoriented
Job Description: Habitat Vietnam is committed to managing operations and stakeholders so as not to do harm to the community and beneficiaries. We are committed to preventing, monitoring and eliminating risks, and strictly handling violations (Safeguarding Policy). Therefore, our recruitment process will require candidates to provide criminal records and contact information of 03 managers they have worked with for reference check. We recruit people based on the suitable knowledge, skills, and experience compared to job requirements and the candidates' commitment to share Habitat's values. Recruitment and work opportunities are fair for candidates regardless of age, origin, race, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability,. Candidates who are interested in Habitat’s Vision & Mission and qualified for the job please send us your comprehensive CV & Cover Letter in English highlighting your interest and capabilities. Please also mention in the CV/Cover Letter the contact details (including telephone number and email) of 3 referees including the most recent direct supervisors. All potential candidates are welcome. However, your application form will be screened and only suitable candidates will be contacted. Job Summary. The Resource Development and Communications Specialist will:. 1) Contribute to the development and implementation of the resource development and communications strategy of Habitat Vietnam, supplementing the advancement of overall engagement and fund development performance while facilitating the application of best practices in Foundation, Organization, Institutional (FOI), corporate and major gifts fundraising. 2) Support and develop local partnerships and contribute to project development and the drafting of quality proposals, facilitating and coordinating fundraising initiatives and communication campaigns. 3) Deliver high quality communication materials to different audiences, ensuring deepened relationships with donors and partners, including enhanced and effective media outreach. 4) Lead the implementation of specific initiatives e.g., housing forum. 5) This position will also be a stakeholder in Habitat Vietnam’s Advocacy Committee. 6) Establish and manage key constituents to elicit support for and maximize impact of advocacy efforts of Habitat Vietnam. Key working relationships. Key internal contact:national director, senior management, country operations management (finance, program, MEAL, volunteer and institutional engagement, safeguarding…). Key external contact:donor parties, Habitat for Humanity Asia Pacific regional RD, communications and relevant units, Habitat for Humanity International, CSOs, NGOs, corporate executives, government agencies…. Key Accountabilities/Responsibilities. 1.Resource development. Identify funding and partnership prospects and opportunities to mobilize support for the realization of Habitat Vietnam’s strategic plan. Cultivate corporate, FOI, affiliate pipelines, targets, forecasts, prepositioning activities, Go/No Go, proposal development processes and the review of proposals together with the Habitat Vietnam Development Team. Proactively identify and nurture partnerships with INGOs/NGOs/For Profit as well as private sector entities who can help Habitat Vietnam access new funding streams (e.g. networking, presenting about Habitat Vietnam to find new opportunities). Build and maintain effective relationships domestically and regionally alongside the RD&C Manager and Habitat Vietnam leadership in accordance with the organization’s strategy and plans. Prepare briefings and other information materials that support Habitat Vietnam leadership with corporate, FOI, affiliate engagement as needed. Develop and manage an active relationship with counterparts (including HFHI Global Funding Network and other platforms to gather funding intelligence or leads. Analyze opportunity and donor requirements. Develop donor (corporate, FOI, affiliate…) database and regular monitoring/sharing of opportunities in line with Habitat Vietnam targeted donors and partners. Support the development of specific annual resource development targets and implementation of strategies (including but not limited to grant development and acquisition, annual appeals, special fundraising events – international and corporate/major donor sponsored events locally/domestic CSR, etc.). Manage campaigns and events (i.e. Housing Forum, Habitat Youth Leaders Build, World Habitat Day, etc.) together with the volunteer and institutional engagement team and collaborated with counterparts at the regional level. Coordinate donor/partner visits and provide general support, as needed, and develop itineraries that will strongly engage prospect donors. Coordinate resource development and engagement activities together with other departments and across programsproject leads and national office support teams. Develop and implement local and international engagement programs (for highnetworth individuals, influencers /celebrities, cause marketing partners, among others). Creatively bring about fitforpurpose, current and agile engagement and fundraising programs befitting the Vietnamese context. Effectively represent Habitat Vietnam in meetings. 2. Stewardship. Support the cultivation and stewardship of resources and relationships. Contribute to grant tracking and monitor donor compliance. 3. Communications. Contribute to the development and implementation of the Habitat Vietnam’s fiveyear resource development and communications strategies. INTERNAL COMMUNICATION:. Review, draft, update and socialize internal communications. Disseminate Branding Guidelines, Photo and Communication Policy, etc. and build internal capacity. Support relevant departments in managing the inventory of stock. Collaborate with other departments in organizing internal culture activities such as annual staff conference, family day, staff meeting, communication training for staff, etc. EXTERNAL COMMUNICATION:. Contribute to the development of communication plan for the organization, including Habitat Vietnam’s advocacy communications plan. Develop and maintain a variety of creative external communications materials and lead the distribution management: program briefs, country profiles, monthly enewsletter, annual report, program reports, most significant change and impact stories, web and social media updates, campaign materials, etc. Manage Habitat Vietnam website and social media (Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram & Twitter) and GROW Habitat Vietnam’s presence in them. Manage campaigns and special events in partnership with Volunteer and Institutional Development (i.e., Habitat Young Leaders Build, World Habitat Day, etc.). Manage design agencies or thirdparty creatives when needed. Lead the overall media coordination and outreach, including the management of media database serving as the organization’s media contact. Coordinate and work closely with schools in Vietnam to establish the Habitat Club in accordance with HFHI and with Vietnam regulations. Write homeowner, community, partner impact stories, most significant change stories, progress stories and manage publication and distribution. Manage the design and production of Habitat Vietnam merch / collaterals; procure samples and finished products. Monitoring branding application. Monitor translations and transcriptions of Vietnamese to English language viceversa of media coverage and the like. Provide translation for key events such as project launch ceremonies, housing forum, round table discussion, house dedication or internal workshop and meetings. Manage photo and video assets of Habitat Vietnam. Organize and participate in external networking and marketing communications events. Collaborate with Asia Pacific Communications team for regional campaigns and events. Work across the organization, building strong relationships with colleagues to stay informed of latest organizational and field developments. Conduct relevant administrative activities as required. 4.Managing assets and budget. Manage the annual budget for Communications to strategically and tactically grow Habitat Vietnam’s profile and outreach. Set and control a new budget for content marketing and paidfor digital advertising to increase Habitat Vietnam’s engagement through social media channels. Propose potential vendors to Finance team for the continuous live review and update of the Master Vendor list. Manage communications asset movement and inventory in collaboration with the Finance Department (if needed). Approve localized communication materials. Confirm logistical requirements on behalf of the team. Assign RDC assets to relevant staff during special fundraising events/builds. Provide Habitat Vietnam information to various legitimate partners. Directly manage junior (entry level) staff or intern/s that will support in the overall resource development & communications of Habitat Vietnam. 5.Compliance and alignment with policies. Study and abide by the Ethics Covenant, Safeguarding, Child Protection, Discrimination, Bullying and Harassment policies. Engage in and maintain a safe working relationship with colleagues and local partners in accordance with HFH Vietnam policies. Respect and safeguard the rights and dignities of all people, and protect our staff members, volunteers, partners, beneficiaries, research participants, and community members (especially vulnerable adults and children) from bullying, sexual abuse and exploitation, and sexual harassment. Working condition & context. Based in Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh with quarterly or biquarterly domestic travels and fieldbased (rural and urban) activities, and some international travels. Standard Performance Expectation. Core prospecting, prepositioning, fundraising, relationship cultivation and management, and communications objectives are met on time and of high quality. Through funding acquisitions and formed relationships, contributed to the achievement of Habitat Vietnam’s annual fundraising targets. Established procedures and guidelines are implemented, monitored and supplemented. Written products in both English and Vietnamese are of quality and duly provided to National Office and various programs in a timely manner. Communication materials are creatively produced and constantly updated. The level of satisfaction of donors and funding partners is continually high and varying levels of expectations are highly managed. Events managed successfully are creatively delivered, and with high fundraising and participation turn out. Habitat Vietnam’s Societal Impact has grown as demonstrated in awareness elevated quality of raising activities, social media efforts, advocacy communications, and media outreach. Amplified media connections of Habitat Vietnam for general communications and advocacy. Performed work in synergy and in cohesion with crossfunctional units/departments

Skills Recommended: Procurement, Procurement Planning, Supply Chain Management, Business Law, Planning
Address Recommended: Hà Nội, Vietnam
Job Requierements: Required Qualifications. A University degree, preferably in one or more of the following disciplines: business administration, management or business law, Procurement and Supply Chain Management,. Master’s degree or Professional Certification in relevant field will be an added advantage;. Good knowledge of MS Office package and office management systems;. Proven experience in Procurement / Contract management or other related relevant role. Required Skills and Competencies. At least 5 years working experience in procurement/purchasing and supply chain related position, among which at least 3 years experience in contract negotiation and management, preferably in a notforprofit organization;. Knowledge of Procurement rules and regulations of USIAD, UN, EU, Germany Government or any other multilateral/ bilateral organizations is an advantage;. Good communication and negotiation skills;. Good interpersonal & organizational skills, attention to details, high sense of confidentiality & trustworthy;. Ability to work in multicultural environment;. Ability to work under pressure to pursue multiple tasks simultaneously to successful conclusions;. Demonstrate high level of integrity;. Proficiency in English;. Good computer skills: spreadsheets, word processing, MS Excel, Macro. Identifies and aligns with the core values of the WWF organization: Courage, Collaboration, Respect & Integrity;. Adheres to WWF’s brand values: Knowledgeable, Optimistic, Determined and Engaging;. Demonstrates WWF behaviours in ways of working: strive for impact, listen deeply, collaborate openly and innovate fearlessly. Working Relationships:. Internal: Interact on a regular basis with Procurement and Contract management team, Project Finance and relevant project/function focal points,. External:Interacts with suppliers, consultants and field offices as required in fulfilment of duties. This job description covers the main tasks and conveys the spirit of the sort of tasks that are anticipated proactively from staff. Other tasks may be assigned as necessary according to organizational needs.
Job Description: I. Background. WWF was one of the first International nongovernment organizations working in Vietnam. In 1985, WWF began working on a national conservation strategy and since then has worked closely with the Vietnamese Government on a diverse range of environment issues and implemented field activities across the country. Find out more at http://vietnam.panda.org/. WWF recognizes that its employees are its most important asset. A competent workforce, thoroughly trained, properly motivated, and bound together by mutual trust and common objectives is crucial to the success of WWF. II. Mission of the Department:. To ensure the effective management and control of WWFViet Nam and Greater Mekong (GM Hub) finances through the identification and management of financial and operational risk and through timely and accurate financial planning, budgeting, accounting and reporting, including compliance with Swiss GAAP requirements. To provide strategic advice/support to the WWFViet Nam Country Management Team (CMT). Leads the financial accounting and reporting activities for the office and sets the policies and procedures for the financerelated operational processes to ensure an adequate financial control environment. Ensures strong governance, control, oversight and stewardship are in place to enable risk management and mitigation. Manages the finance and operations aspects of general accounting function. III. Major Functions:. Under the direct supervision of the Finance Director, The Procurement and Contract Manager will oversee the procurement and contract management functions for WWF Vietnam Programme , ensuring compliance with local policies, donor requirements, and international best practices. This position is responsible for supervising a team involved in the full procurement cycle, from sourcing and supplier evaluation to contract preparation and management. The manager will work closely with various internal teams to ensure procurement and contract management processes are efficient, transparent, and align with the organization's strategic goals. IV. Major Duties and Responsibilities:. The Procurement and Contract Manager key roles and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:. 1. Procurement Oversight:. Provide direct management for Procurement team to ensure procurement activities are fully compliant with donor regulations, legal requirements, and internal policies. Responsible for reviewing/endorsing and/or approving all procurements within delegated authority. Regularly review the international procurement process to ensure WWFVN's regulations align with international policies, promote open competition, and provide equal opportunities to all suppliers, while upholding integrity, accountability, and transparency. 2. Contract Management Oversight. Provide direct management for contract team to ensure contracting activities are effective, fully compliant with donor regulations, legal requirements, and internal policies. Oversee the preparation, negotiation, and management of contracts with external suppliers, consultants, and service providers, including amendments, renewals, extensions, and terminations, ensuring terms are clear, fair, and aligned with organizational needs. Directly join and/or lead the contract negotiation process as required. Directly review/ approve contracts within delegated authority. Act as the primary liaison for WWF Vietnam, coordinating with the International Legal Team on all contract matters. Develop and maintain standardized contract templates for the most convenience use of WWF Vietnam. Develop and regular review contract review process. Act as Contract management champion of WWF Vietnam to regularly update contract related policies and guidance from International and local law to ensure full compliance of contract activities. Responsible for providing necessary information and collaboration with System Management Officer in the process of developing Contract management system. 3. Reporting and auditing. Responsible for regular update procurement and contract management issue to Finance Director, highlighting key achievements, challenges, and areas for improvement. Identify all potential risks associated with procurement and contracting activities and timely report to Finance Director with mitigations plan. Maintain accurate and organized records of procurement processes, contracts, and supporting documentation for audit purposes. Ensure effective justification for donor requests and audits, providing clear and welldocumented rationale. Collaborate with relevant functions to resolve any procurement and/ or contract disputes or issues that may arise. Implement and oversee procurement audits, spot checks, and assessments to ensure compliance with both internal and donor requirements. 4. Team Leadership and Capacity Building:. Lead, manage, and develop the procurement and contract management team, ensuring high performance, professional growth, and adherence to best practices. Directly deliver regular training for contract management team to ensure an effective contract support. Ensure appropriate training to staffs and stakeholders on procurement policies, procedures, and compliance requirements. Perform regular visit to field office for monitoring and training purpose. Monitor team performance, provide feedback, and conduct regular performance appraisals.

Job Title Recommended: Senior Advisor- Strengthening Interconnections Between Innovation Actors -Component 2 Lead - USAID Project
Skills Recommended: Government Projects, Consulting, NGO Networks
Address Recommended: 12th Floor, Vinaconex Building, 34 Lang Ha, Dong Da District, Hanoi, Vietnam
Job Requierements: Qualifications:. Education: Master's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Public Policy, International Development, or a related field. Experience: At least 8 years of experience in managing and implementing international development projects, preferably with USAID or other donorfunded projects. Experience in innovation, technology commercialization, and ecosystem development is highly desirable. Skills:. Strong leadership and management skills. Excellent analytical and problemsolving abilities. Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders. Strong communication and presentation skills. Familiarity with 4IR technologies and their commercialization processes. Language: Proficiency in English is required. Knowledge of Vietnamese is an asset. Other: Ability to work in a fastpaced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Please note that Deloitte will never reach out to you directly via messaging platforms to offer you employment opportunities or request for money or your personal information. Kindly apply for roles that you are interested in via this official Deloitte website.
Job Description: Are you ready to unleash your potential?. At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve. We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purposeled growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices. Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals. We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions. Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!. At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals. Deloitte Southeast Asia’s International Affairs and Development practice is currently accepting applications from qualified candidates for the forthcoming USAID Vietnam Innovative Ecosystems Activity. This Activity will support the Government of Vietnam (GVN) in its effort to enhance Vietnam’s innovation ecosystems by promoting the commercialization of innovations developed by innovators, entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs. To do this the Activity aims to link Innovation Ecosystem Actors (IEAs) like national, regional, and higher education institution innovation centers, Vietnamese owned/operated enterprises, chambers of commerce, business associations, and think tanks to improve the innovation ecosystem business enabling environment. The Activity will also work with and through key IEAs to develop the business acumen and startup skills of innovators, entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs. Work you will do. Project: USAID Project on Strengthening Vietnam's Innovation Ecosystem. Reports To: Deputy Chief of Party (DCOP). Position Summary: The Component 2 Lead will oversee the implementation of Component 2 of the USAIDfunded project aimed at strengthening Vietnam's innovation ecosystem to drive the commercialization of Fourth Industrial Revolution (4IR) innovations. This component focuses on strengthening interconnections between innovation actors and those furnishing related resources, developing the capabilities of Business Support Organizations (BSOs), the National Innovation Center (NIC), and other relevant Government of Vietnam (GVN) agencies, and facilitating careerenhancing interconnections between GVN agencies, Higher Education Institutions (HEIs), and the private sector. Key Responsibilities:. Subcomponent 2.1: Support and Develop Capabilities of NIC, GVN Agencies, and BSOs. Develop Capabilities of BSOs and NIC:. Identify and provide technical assistance to selected BSOs to enhance their ability to convene key stakeholders. Strengthen the NIC's capacity to independently and sustainably engage stakeholders. Facilitate stakeholder dialogue through recurring events to identify and prioritize key challenges. Aggregate and synthesize recommendations for presentation to GVN agencies. Design and Hold Forums:. Cultivate input from key stakeholders to identify purposeful and valueadding forum themes and objectives. Design, plan, and execute forums to serve the needs and interests of key stakeholders. Conduct exchanges of information, experiences, and best practices among stakeholders. Facilitate outreach to and engagement with complementary regional and international stakeholders. Provide needsbased training on commercializing innovations and managing business operations. Conduct investorled forums to raise awareness of equity investors' and lenders' requirements. Promote innovative thinking and creativity to improve business productivity through seminars and forums. Subcomponent 2.2: Develop FeeBased Services for GOBs. Develop Capabilities of NIC, GVN Agencies, and BSOs:. Identify and provide technical assistance to selected BSOs to deliver feebased services. Strengthen the NIC's capacity to sustainably deliver advisory services to GOBs. Advise GOBs on commercializing innovative products and services, enhancing operational efficiencies, and meeting investors' and lenders' requirements. Provide advisory services to help GOBs identify opportunities to maximize efficiency and productivity. Subcomponent 2.3: Facilitate CareerEnhancing Interconnections. Strengthen Linkages Between GVN Agencies, HEIs, and Private Sector:. Collaborate with relevant GVN ministry, HEI, and private sector representatives to define immediate and future demands of 4IR, business, and soft skills. Enhance HEIs' career placement centers to develop and implement formal internship, externship, and apprenticeship opportunities. Facilitate collaboration between private sector actors and HEIs' research and development facilities. Establish "clubs" at HEIs to provide business and soft skills mentoring and coaching services. Conduct forums with investors to raise awareness of equity investors' and lenders' requirements.

Company Name: U.S. Mission Vietnam – U.S. Embassy In Hanoi
Skills Recommended: Laboratory Management, Quality Management System, English, Public Health, Laboratory
Address Recommended: Hà Nội, Vietnam
Job Requierements: QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS. Education:A master’s degree in laboratory management, laboratory systems or international equivalent is required. Experience:A minimum of three years of experience in working and/or managing laboratory systems, including experience in quality management systems is required. Within these three years, a minimum of two years of experience in developing, implementing and evaluating health programs and coordination with international agencies or implementing partners is required. Languages:. Fluency in Speaking/Reading/Writing English is required. (This will be tested.). Fluency in Speaking/Reading/Writing Vietnamese is required. HOW TO APPLY. Applicants should click the link https://bit.ly/3NyrV8n to submit their applications through Electronic Recruitment Application (ERA) byNovember 4, 2024to be considered. Applications via emails are no longer accepted. Position description and guidance on how to apply are available on the Embassy’s website. https://vn.usembassy.gov/jobs/. POINT OF CONTACT:Human Resources Office
Job Description: OPEN TO:All Interested Applicants. POSITION:Public Health Specialist (Laboratory). OPEN PERIOD:October 21, 2024 – Nov 4, 2024. WORK HOURS:Fulltime, 40 hours/week. STARTING BASIC SALARY: US $25,836.00/year. ALLOWANCE AND BENEFITS: Tet Bonus, annual salary increase, local social security system, supplemental health insurance, other allowance, and benefits. BASIC FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION. This position will serve as the Public Health Specialist for the Global Health Security (GHS) Laboratory Program at the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) office at the U.S. Embassy in Hanoi, Vietnam. In this capacity, the position holder will provide significant technical and program management leadership with advancing Vietnam to achieve the Global Health Security Agenda (GHSA) target for a laboratory system:“A nationwide laboratory system, including all relevant sectors, capable of safely and accurately detecting and characterizing pathogens causing epidemic disease and chemical threats, including both known and unknown threats from all parts of the country.”. The position holder will act as a U.S. Government (USG) interagency subject matter expert and technical advisor in all efforts undertaken by CDC Vietnam and the interagency to advance implementation for achieving the aforementioned laboratory target, working in close collaboration with the rest of the CDC Vietnam’s GHS Laboratory Strengthening Team in Hanoi, as well as other technical officers within the USG interagency, including the Department of Defense (DOD), Defense Threat Reduction Agency (DTRA), and the United States Agency for International Development (USAID). The position holder will develop and execute strategies, and work plans supportive of achieving this laboratory target. The job holder will work with the rest of CDC Vietnam’s GHS Laboratory Strengthening Team, the CDC Vietnam Laboratory Branch, and across CDC Vietnam’s multiple programs and branches, including the CDC office in Ho Chi Minh City, to coordinate, facilitate, mentor, and/or directly provide capacity development support for Vietnam’s laboratory staff in strengthening systems for Laboratory. Target beneficiaries include national and subnational laboratories and other clinical and preventive medicine actors across the Ministry of Health (MOH) and other line ministries, including the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) and the Ministry of Defense (MOD). The job holder will be the primary routine liaison with the USG Interagency team, other bilateral and multilateral partners, especially, but not limited to, the World Health Organization in Vietnam, the Food and Agricultural Organization, USAID, and DTRA across all activities pertaining to laboratory strengthening. The position holder will also provide support for general laboratory workforce development through trainings and inkind technical assistance to all levels of laboratories, including district, province, regional, and national. The position holder will work with CDC Headquarters (HQ) and CDC Vietnam, as well as other international and local stakeholders, to build the capacity of laboratory staff in Vietnam.

Job Requierements: Person Specification. Education & Certifications. Bachelor in Social science, economic and development studies or related to ActionAid programmes contents. Experience. Minimum 3 years of experience working on similar projects and community development. Experience of working within a multicultural team. Essential knowledge and skills. Leadership and management. Outstanding analytical skills with a strong background in basic research. Networking, influencing and interpersonal. Excellent management of competing priorities and work under pressure. Fluency in written and spoken English and native/national language. Ability to work independently. Work on own initiative with minimum supervision and to stay on task. This job description covers the main task and conveys the spirit of the sort of tasks that are anticipate proactively from staff. Job Description: Programme Development Support (Application LINK: https://tadaa.actionaid.vn/applicationform/4xgfqj8befqkbzqntv7zq3a75e). Job Title:PROGRAMME DEVELOPMENT SUPPORT. Reports to:Head of Programme Development. Financial Approval Responsibilities: No. Location:Hanoi office with travels to the fields and internationally as required. Full time job: Yes. Key Relationships to reach solutions: Internal: Members of PRG, EDO, OPN, FIN, CLT, ActionAid International. External: ActionAid Vietnam’s Partners, LRPs, community members. Role Overview. Being a member of Programme Priorities Programme Department, the Programme Development Support handles tasks of assigned projects/Programe Priority (PP). Besides, he/she will assist tasks related coordination and implementation of AAV’s projects and campaigns. Role Accountabilities. (I) Development, coordination and implementation of PP projects/programme. 1.Connecting stakeholders in development, coordination and implementation of AAV’s Programme Priority projects in accordance with AAV’s strategy. 2.Ensuring that all research and advocacy projects in charge are implemented timely and with quality, within the budget available. 3.Monitoring project activities in progress, quality and compliance of stakeholders throughout the project implementation process. (II) Supervision and implementation of AAV’s Country Strategy Paper Programme Priority in charge. 1.Identifying and proposing to AAV on solutions to implement PP in charge as committed in the AAV’s Country Strategy Paper, including (but not limited to) selecting the appropriate consultants/partners/subcontractors for activities, designing the programmes and network for full delivery of PP in charge. 2.Supporting the partners’ and (sub)contractors’ to fully comply with AAV regulations. 3.Conduct field visits to programme areas to provide support, learn more on partner’s requirement to ensure PP activity are implemented effectively. (III) Support administration for PP/ Programme Department. 1.Set up, maintain and update a good (soft and hard) filing system of programme/project reports/documents and official letters. 2.Set up, maintain and update LRPs’ contact database. 3.Prepare and translate (if needed) requested programme/project documents and communications are well in high quality and in a timely manner. 4.Efficiently plan and execute meetings, travels, and other administrative tasks. (IV) Involves in fundraising activities and donor services. 1.Consolidate data and information for PP team to prepare concept notes, proposals for fundraising and donor reports. 2.Handling donor visits and enquires as requires. (V) Participate in programme/project’s campaigning, networking, advocacy activities. 3.Consolidate data and information for PP team to organize policy research, advocacy events and campaigns. 4.Well scope local and international working groups, networks and campaigns. 5.Prepare requested materials for networking. (VI) Assists in capacity building for staff/partners and research activities. 1.Provide supports in organizing trainings, workshops and other capacity building activities. 2.Provide supports in research activities including contribute to desk study, toolkits building, data collection, data analysis, report drafting and revision. (VII) Conduct partnerships management. 1.Participate in identifying and initiating strategic networks, alliances, and partnership with government agencies, local right programs, and academic and research institutions, etc. (VIII) Supports partners in planning, budgeting, and implementing the project. 1.Provide annual planning and budgeting guidance to partners in accordance with the guidelines from the annual planning team as well as the related functions. 2.Review and approve partners’ project’s TORs, work plans and budget, fund requests. 3.Regular field level visits are conducted to project areas to provide support and supervision, and guide project implementation. 4.Well prepare MOUs and other legal documents of related partners on time. (IX) Conduct project reviews, monitoring, evaluation, program learning and reporting. 1.Establish and operate the project monitoring framework, metrics, and reporting systems for the projects; adequate monitoring and evaluation is conducted for all projects. 2.Conduct project’s reviews and evaluation in line with the ALPS and donor’s requirements. 3.Prepare project’s reports within and outside the organization for shared learning. (X) Support the affiliation process of AAV in AAI federation. 1.Participation in relevant tasks assigned is ensured to support the operation of the Aid for Social Protection Program Foundation Vietnam (AFV), the strategic partner of AAV. 2.Assistance is provided for the smooth transition of ActionAid Vietnam in the nationalization process. (XI) Safety & Security. 1.The Safety and Security Plan, Procedures, and guideline by AAI and AAV are followed. 2.The safety and security procedures for staff are implemented. 3.Risks for staff safety and security are timely reported to Security Focal Person or Head of Department. (XII) Others. 1.Other tasks as assigned by line manager are well performed

Job Title Recommended: Central Annamites Landscape Director, WWF Vietnam
Skills Recommended: Environment, NGO Field, Project Management, Natural Resource Management, Program Management
Address Recommended: Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
Job Requierements: Required Qualifications:. Master’s degree in natural resources management, environmental or conservation management, bioregional planning, development studies, or in relevant fields. Qualification in Program Management. Thorough understanding of socioeconomic, conservation and development issues in Vietnam and preferable in the landscape in charge. Knowledge of the policy/institutional context related to conservation and the government agencies, development partners, donor institutions, and the notforprofit sector in the landscape. Excellent understanding of development partnerships, fundraising, donor strategies, functions, governmental and international relations. At least 5 years of experience in leading and managing large programme either in NGOs or the United Nations or bilateral development agencies, 2 years of which should be in the related landscape. Proven experience of managing programmes funded by a diversity of sources including governments and aid agencies, private sector donors with annual budget of multi millions USD. Experience of working in multicultural environment and international organisations. Required Skills and Competencies:. Excellent presentation, communication & interpersonal skills;. Good Leadership and management skills, coaching and capacity building/development skills. Strategic thinking; excellent problem solving skills and decision making. Influencing & Networking skills. Financial management skill. Proposal Development & Report writing skills. Fluency in written and spoken English. Respective Competencies: WWF Focus; External Orientation; Delivery quality outcomes; Building working relationships; Communicate effectively; Leading teams; Leading change; Managing Resources. Adhere to WWF’s values: Knowledgeable, Optimistic, Determined and Engaging. Demonstrates WWF behaviors in ways of working: strive for impact, listen deeply, collaborate openly, and innovate fearlessly. Working Relationships:. Internal: WWF GMP:Interact on a regular basis with CEO, Practice lead, Financial, HR, M&E and Program Development Director, Project/ Programme Managers, other Landscape Managers, Strategy Managers and Technical Advisors at regional and country levels. Engage with and support WWFVietnam staff. WWF Network:Liaise with relevant teams to provide inputs and seek supports as required. External:Interact with all relevant stakeholders at the community, commune, district, and provincial level of provinces in the landscape. Interact with donors, central government partners, and NGOs on adhoc basis. This job description covers the main tasks and conveys the spirit of the sort of tasks that are anticipated proactively from staff. Other tasks may be assigned as necessary according to organizational needs. Location:Based in Hue or Quang Nam provinces.
Job Description: I.Background:. WWF was one of the first International nongovernment organizations working in Vietnam. In 1985, WWF began working on a national conservation strategy and since then has worked closely with the Vietnamese Government on a diverse range of environment issues and implemented field activities across the country. WWFVietnam is part of WWFGreater Mekong Programme (GMP)which operates in 5 countries: Laos, Thailand, Myanmar, Cambodia and Vietnam. Find out more at http://vietnam.panda.org/. II.Major Functions:. The Landscape Director (LD) plays the leading role in the planning, coordination, monitoring and implementation of the WWF efforts to conserve one of the most biodiverse landscape in Vietnam’s, the Central Annamites Landscape (CAL). The LD has the chance to represent WWF Vietnam in the Landscape and is responsible for the conservation and operation, including the planning and management of financial and administrative aspects of the landscape programme. The LD organizes program and project execution consistent with WWF Vietnam country and landscape strategic plan objectives engaging national counterparts and stakeholder, and building reputation for quality design and reliable delivery. III.Major Duties and Responsibilities:. Act as the representative/focal point of WWF Vietnam in the landscape, participate to workshops and meetings, plan and coordinate donors (WWF and others) landscape field visit. Act as the focal point of WWF Vietnam for the transboundary landscape collaboration with WWF Laos and WWF GMP. Accountable of the implementation of the WWF Vietnam Conservation strategy in the Central Annamites Landscape (CAL). Monitor, review and update the landscape strategic plan to demonstrate impacts and to ensure its alignment with the WWF Vietnam conservation action plan and WWF GMP Conservation Strategy, as well as provide support to the evaluation of the landscape program. Manage directly the CAL Nature Base Solutions Programme (NBS), provide technical and managerial guidance to the NBS Lead, represent WWF Vietnam in the NBSOP steering and other meetings. Provide leadership and overall direction and coordination for projects and facilitate and support the implementation of these projects, including project approval processes. Promote and set up mechanism information sharing with Government, CSOs and other organizations. Work with Program Development Director and Chief Conservation Officer, Practice Leads to develop landscape fundraising strategy, NBS strategy in line with GMPO strategic plan and WWF Vietnam country’s priorities, including inputs to new project proposals. Identify program/project delivery issues, propose solutions and ensure effective coordination and management of project resources. Manage, build and maintain networks and partnerships on biodiversity conservation, natural resource management (terrestrial and marine), food and energy, with relevant government agencies, NGO partners, provincial, district and communal authorities, and local communities and attend meetings and workshops in related fields. Responsible as direct line manager of Project Managers, Program Coordinators, Technical Advisors, Project Admin staff, managing performance, providing induction, training, coaching and advice to ensure that they are appropriately motivated and that staff deliver their performance objectives. Work with financial director and staff for program budget preparation for the activities of the landscape in charge, monitoring, and reporting activities; guarantee the financial integrity and accountability of project budgets in the landscape. Involve in the recruitment and selection of staff under supervision and consultants when required. Work with HR Manager to identify training needs and development opportunities for supervised staff, and provide training when required. Review and approve technical reports against the approved work plan and budget plan, as per donor requirements and to the WWF GMPO and Government when required. Provide inputs to communications products and campaigns when required to ensure accurate information will be published to promote the landscape. Coordinate with practice leads and develop informationsharing mechanisms relevant CAL work and organize regularbased meetings/calls. Carry out other tasks assigned by Line Manager

Job Description: Project Operations Manager (GHG) 2 (Application LINK: https://tadaa.actionaid.vn/applicationform/46gmk4k5bqmmd45g0kp5y4r9n. Application should be submitted to ActionAid Vietnam through the link above by 8th November 2024. Reports to:Head of Programme Development. Financial Approval ResponsibilitiesYes, within the budgets as assigned and as per Delegation of Authority Framework (DAF). Location:Head office with travels to the field and internationally as required. Full time job:Yes. Key Relationships to reach solutions:Internal: Members of PRG, EDO, OPN FIN, CLT, ActionAid International. External: ActionAid Vietnam’s Partners, LRPs, community members, Donors, Government Officials, authorities at all levels, Media, Academia, peer NGO/INGOs. Role Overview:. The Project Operations Manager (POM) has responsibility in supporting the development and implementation of ActionAid’s programme and projects, focusing on reduction of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, communitybased disaster preparedness, response, and recovery. Working as budget holder of the Local Right Programmes (LRPs) in charge, POM has authority to review and endorse all documents proposed by LRPs (such as planning and budgeting based on the approved fund requests, financial and narrative reports, monitoring, and evaluation reports, etc.). Other authorities are stated in the Delegation of Authority Framework (DAF). Role Accountabilities:. 1.Strategy. 1.1.Develop new initiatives, projects, and programs on reduction of GHG emission, communitybased disaster preparedness, response, and recovery towards achievements of ActionAid Vietnam’s commitments in its prevailing Country Strategy Priorities (CSP). 2.Governance. 2.1. Thoroughly understand and fully comply with the decisionmaking processes and accountabilities of the organization. 2.2.Actively contribute to building a healthy, transparent, and just governance in ActionAid Vietnam. 3.Fund Raising. 3.1Conduct donor scoping on ad hoc and regular basic to identify funding opportunities for followup. 3.2Engage consortium partners, develop new projects, write concept notes and proposals, develop budget for new projects to respond to the identified funding opportunities. 3.3Enhance donor relationship through donor services (e.g., donor visits, reporting, networking, and other purposive engagements). 4.Organizational Culture Embrace. 4.1Capacity Building. 4.1.1.Conduct needs assessment and deliver capacity building (trainings, inductions, coaching, etc.) for communities, staff, and partners to deliver programs and projects. 4.1.2.Collect, translate, compile, and disseminate programme/project guidance, manuals, handon experience documents to related stakeholders. 4.2Cultural and Human Resources Management. 4.2.1. Performance Management: Adherence to AAVPROFILE (Accountability, Adaptation, Value, Partnership, Respect, Obtain to innovation, Fairness and Justice, Integrity, Leadership without authority, Expertise). 4.2.2. Joint activities for building organizational culture. 4.2.3. Joint actions for capacity building for ActionAid staff and partners. 5.Operations. 5.1.Programme and Projects. 5.1.1.Carry out program/project activities/interventions in accordance with the approved work schedule and budget. 5.1.2.Monitor program and project budgets and expenses, and regularly report to the line manager. 5.2.Research and Advocacy. 5.2.1Identify potential issues and related stakeholders for evidencebased advocacy. 5.2.2Plan and implement communication and advocacy campaigns and events. 5.2.3Ensure timely release of position statement, policy briefs, research reports, and other essential publications for campaigning and advocacy. 5.2.4Contribute at least one story of change per month to update ActionAid's website and social media sites. 5.3.Partnership Management. 5.3.1.Contribute to developing ActionAid’s partnership strategy and plans. 5.3.2.Conduct networking and screening to identify partnership opportunity for followup. 5.3.3.Follow up with partnership MoU, agreement contract with new and existing partners. 5.3.4.Provide guidance, review, and approve partners’ programme concept, proposals, work plans and budget, fund requests, narrative reports, and financial reports. 5.3.5.Conduct regular field level visits to programme areas to provide support and supervision, and guide programme implementation. 5.4.Monitoring and Evaluation. 5.4.1.Establish and operate monitoring framework, systems, tools, tracking, data consolidation for programs and projects. 5.4.2.Prepare the program/project reports to ensure ActionAid’s commitments with donors, partners, government agencies and other related stakeholders. 5.4.3.Consolidate lessons learnt, gaps, good practices for sharing and learning among ActionAid’s staff and partners. 5.5.Others: Deliver other tasks assigned by line manager.

Job Title Recommended: Senior Advisor - Capability Building for Nic - Component 3 Lead- USAID Project
Skills Recommended: Government Projects, Consulting, NGO Networks
Address Recommended: 12th Floor, Vinaconex Building, 34 Lang Ha, Dong Da District, Hanoi, Vietnam
Job Requierements: Qualifications:. Education: Master's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Public Policy, International Development, or a related field. Experience: At least 8 years of experience in managing and implementing international development projects, preferably with USAID or other donorfunded projects. Experience in innovation, technology commercialization, and ecosystem development is highly desirable. Skills:. Strong leadership and management skills. Excellent analytical and problemsolving abilities. Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders. Strong communication and presentation skills. Familiarity with 4IR technologies and their commercialization processes. Language: Proficiency in English is required. Knowledge of Vietnamese is an asset. Other: Ability to work in a fastpaced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Please note that Deloitte will never reach out to you directly via messaging platforms to offer you employment opportunities or request for money or your personal information. Kindly apply for roles that you are interested in via this official Deloitte website.
Job Description: Are you ready to unleash your potential?. At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve. We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purposeled growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices. Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals. We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions. Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!. At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals. Deloitte Southeast Asia’s International Affairs and Development practice is currently accepting applications from qualified candidates for the forthcoming USAID Vietnam Innovative Ecosystems Activity. This Activity will support the Government of Vietnam (GVN) in its effort to enhance Vietnam’s innovation ecosystems by promoting the commercialization of innovations developed by innovators, entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs. To do this the Activity aims to link Innovation Ecosystem Actors (IEAs) like national, regional, and higher education institution innovation centers, Vietnamese owned/operated enterprises, chambers of commerce, business associations, and think tanks to improve the innovation ecosystem business enabling environment. The Activity will also work with and through key IEAs to develop the business acumen and startup skills of innovators, entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs. Work you will do. Project: USAID Project on Strengthening Vietnam's Innovation Ecosystem. Reports To: Deputy Chief of Party (DCOP). Position Summary: The Component 3 Lead will oversee the implementation of Component 3 of the USAIDfunded project aimed at strengthening Vietnam's innovation ecosystem to drive the commercialization of Fourth Industrial Revolution (4IR) innovations. This component focuses on developing the capabilities of the National Innovation Center (NIC) to effectively serve as the focal agency for innovation in Vietnam. The Component 3 Lead will play a crucial role in building the management and technical capacity of NIC leadership and staff, fostering collaboration among stakeholders, and leveraging NIC’s central role to enhance the innovation ecosystem. Key Responsibilities:. Strengthen NIC’s Capabilities and Capacities. Train NIC Personnel:. Provide training on innovation and entrepreneurship management. Enhance organizational governance skills of NIC staff. Technical and Leadership Training:. Deliver tailored technical and leadership training to NIC staff. Empower NIC personnel to be effective facilitators of innovation and productivity enhancement. Management and Technical Skills Development:. Strengthen NIC’s management and technical skills to operate as a onestop shop. Foster the exchange of policies and mechanisms among diverse stakeholders. Foster Collaboration Among Stakeholders. Leverage NIC’s Central Role:. Utilize NIC’s status as the focal point for Vietnam's innovation ecosystem to strengthen linkages among relevant stakeholders, including international counterparts. Facilitate connections and collaborations among local and international stakeholders to enhance the flow of knowledge and resources. Expand NIC Sponsored Networks:. Strengthen and expand NICsponsored networks (e.g., Vietnamese diaspora) to provide advice and support to GrowthOriented Businesses (GOBs). Facilitate coaching and mentorship connections through NIC networks. Convening Power of NIC:. Leverage NIC’s convening power to bring together relevant stakeholders to enhance Vietnam’s innovation ecosystem. Organize events and forums to foster collaboration and knowledge exchange. Utilize Digital Technology and Platforms. Support Digital Integration:. Assist NIC in utilizing digital technology and platforms to serve all innovation ecosystem stakeholders. Facilitate access to mentoring, resources, and collaboration opportunities through digital platforms. Ensure NIC can assume technical responsibility for any new systems introduced.

Job Description: Quản lý Tuyển dụng (Tài xế Taxi) quản lý các hoạt động tuyển dụng Mass của Công ty và chịu trách nhiệm các công việc: Dẫn dắt đội ngũ tuyển dụng, phát triển chiến lược tuyển dụng và đảm bảo số lượng cũng như chất lượng tài xế đáp ứng nhu cầu của Công ty. Giám sát, hướng dẫn và hỗ trợ đội ngũ tuyển dụng trong quá trình thực hiện các nhiệm vụ hàng ngày. Đảm bảo đội ngũ tuyển dụng hoạt động hiệu quả, đạt chỉ tiêu đề ra và tuân thủ các quy trình, quy định của công ty. Thu thập và phân tích dữ liệu liên quan đến tuyển dụng tài xế, bao gồm tỷ lệ ứng viên, tỷ lệ giữ chân, và hiệu suất làm việc của tài xế. Báo cáo định kỳ cho ban lãnh đạo về kết quả tuyển dụng và đề xuất các biện pháp cải thiện chiến lược tuyển dụng. Phát triển và thực hiện quy trình tuyển dụng hiệu quả để thu hút và chọn lọc tài xế phù hợp với yêu cầu và tiêu chuẩn của công ty. Xây dựng và duy trì các công cụ và phương pháp đánh giá ứng viên, bao gồm phỏng vấn, kiểm tra kỹ năng, và kiểm tra hồ sơ. Tìm kiếm và phát triển nguồn cung Tài xế. Duy trì mối quan hệ với các tổ chức giáo dục, trường đào tạo nghề, và các nguồn cung cấp tài xế tiềm năng. Tổ chức phỏng vấn đánh giá và lựa chọn Tài xế. Quản lý Quy trình đào tạo và hội nhập. Quản lý hồ sơ đầu vào của tài xế, bàn giao cho đầy đủ cho bộ phận Nhân sự

Address Recommended: Tầng 4, ga hàng hóa ALS, Cảng HKQT Nội bài, Phú Minh, Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội
Job Requierements: Trình độ học vấn: Tốt nghiệp các trường Đại học, cao đẳng trở lên. Trình độ ngoại ngữ: 300 điểm Toeic hoặc các chứng chỉ khác tương đương hoặc đọc hiểu các tài liệu, văn bản tiếng Anh. Trình độ tin học: Sử dụng tin học văn phòng Word, Excel tốt. Có kỹ năng giao tiếp tốt. Phẩm chất: Trung thực, có trách nhiệm, chăm chỉ. + Có khả năng tự triển khai chi tiết các bước thực hiện công việc được giao. + Có khả năng làm việc nhóm. + Có khả năng làm việc dưới áp lực cao. *** Ưu tiên:. Có sức khỏe: Tốt. Giới tính: Nam. Độ tuổi: Từ 20 tuổi trở lên. QUYỀN LỢI ĐƯỢC HƯỞNG. Thu nhập: từ 7.5 triệu đồng trở lên. Các chế phúc lợi: Thưởng các ngày lễ tết thật hấp dẫn chi tiết sẽ trao đổi khi phỏng vấn. Công ty cung cấp bữa ăn theo ca làm việc. Có thể làm việc được theo ca (do đặc thù công việc phục vụ các hãng bay 24/7 nên ngày nghỉ có thể không phải là ngày thứ 7 và chủ nhật). Du lịch nghỉ mát hàng năm. Tham gia BHXH, BHYT, BHTN đầy đủ. Tham gia bảo hiểm sức khỏe, tai nạn cho NLĐ. Khám sức khỏe định kỳ hàng năm. Có xe đưa đón từ nội thành Hà Nội
Job Description: * Nhân viên sẽ phụ trách làm một số mảng công việc sau (chi tiết sẽ trao đổi khi phỏng vấn). Tham gia phục vụ quá trình nhập xuất hàng hóa bằng đường hàng không. Xử lý tài liệu theo từng chuyến bay. Nhập số liệu, thông tin lô hàng vào hệ thống quản lý. Hướng dẫn chất xếp hàng lên thiết bị chất xếp của tàu bay theo tiêu chuẩn, quy định của hãng vận chuyển đối với từng loại tàu bay. Kiểm tra tài liệu hàng hóa nguy hiểm theo các tiêu chuẩn vận chuyển của IATA, hãng vận chuyển, các quy định của các quốc gia mà tàu bay đi, đến và trung chuyển. Kiểm tra bao bì, nhãn mác của hàng hóa nguy hiểm theo các tiêu chuẩn vận chuyển của IATA, hãng vận chuyển, các quy định của các quốc gia mà tàu bay đi, đến và trung chuyển. Xác định trọng lượng và kích thước kiện hàng, lô hàng nguy hiểm theo quy chuẩn của IATA, hãng vận chuyển. Nhận hàng và tài liệu bàn giao khi máy bay hạ cánh. Chuẩn bị tài liệu hàng hóa được vận chuyển theo từng chuyến bayIn hóa đơn hoặc giấy xác nhận dịch vụ. Quản lý hàng hóa nhập, xuất kho. Thực hiện các công việc khác theo sự phân công, hướng dẫn của cán bộ trực ca, tổ, phòng,…

Job Title Recommended: [HCM] Chuyên Viên Quản Lý Đối Tác/account Manager (Mảng Vận Tải)
Company Name: Công Ty CP Giải Pháp Thanh Toán Việt Nam (VNPAY)
Skills Recommended: Phân Tích Dữ Liệu, Vận Tải, Tìm Kiếm Khách Hàng, Ký Hợp Đồng, Đàm Phán Hợp Đồng
Address Recommended: Tầng 12, tòa nhà Minh Long, số 17 Bà Huyện Thanh Quan, P. Võ Thị Sáu, Q.3, TP. Hồ Chí Minh
Job Requierements: Tốt nghiệp Cao đẳng/ Đại học chuyên ngành Kinh tế, tài chính, ngân hàng, thương mại, quản trị kinh doanh hoặc các ngành nghề tương đương. Có ít nhất 12 năm kinh nghiệm ở vị trí tương đương. Có hiểu biết, kiến thức về lĩnh vực vận tải. Kỹ năng đàm phán, thuyết trình, giao tiếp tốt. Có kỹ năng xây dựng văn bản, tài liệu, phân tích và tổng hợp báo cáo. Sử dụng thành thạo Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint), kỹ năng soạn thảo văn bản tốt. Cẩn thận, nhanh nhẹn, chu đáo, nhiệt tình trong công việc. Chủ động, sáng tạo, có tư duy logic tốt. Ngoại hình ưa nhìn, nhanh nhẹn, sẵn sàng đi công tác xa. Có tinh thần kỷ luật và trách nhiệm cao. CHẾ ĐỘ PHÚC LỢI. 1. Chế độ lương & thưởng hấp dẫn:. Mức lương thỏa thuận theo năng lực, đánh giá năng lực hàng năm;. Chế độ thưởng phong phú và hấp dẫn (Theo quy định và chính sách công ty);. Hỗ trợ ăn sáng miễn phí;. Hỗ trợ ăn trưa: 50.000đ/ngày;. Hỗ trợ gửi xe, xăng xe, điện thoại (tùy vị trí). Hỗ trợ trang điểm cho CBNV nữ;. Quà tặng các ngày lễ trong năm. 2. Bảo hiểm & chăm sóc sức khỏe toàn diện:. BHXH, BHYT, BHTN theo pháp luật hiện hành;. Gói bảo hiểm sức khỏe cao cấp 24/7 mua cho nhân viên & người thân nhân viên;. Khám sức khỏe định kỳ hàng năm. 3. Môi trường làm việc hiện đại:. Cung cấp máy tính & trang thiết bị làm việc hiện đại;. Văn phòng làm việc hiện đại, trang thiết bị làm việc Hitech;. Không gian ăn nhẹ miễn phí (nước uống, trà cafe, hoa quả, sữa chua). 4. Phát triển nghề nghiệp:. Cơ hội tiếp cận với những công nghệ mới, những dự án quy mô lớn;. Làm việc cùng đội ngũ hơn 1000 nhân sự tài năng, có chuyên môn giỏi, dày dặn kinh nghiệm, tư duy chia sẻ;. Được tài trợ kinh phí tham gia các chương trình đào tạo nâng cao năng lực;. Công ty thành lập hơn 16 năm với các sản phẩm & dịch vụ đã được khẳng định vị thế trên thị trường. 5. Hoạt động ngoại khóa phong phú:. Văn hóa công ty đặc sắc với nhiều hoạt động đoàn thể được quan tâm đầu tư: Team building, Nghỉ mát (trong nước và nước ngoài), 20/10, Year End Party, hoạt động thiện nguyện,…. Các câu lạc bộ:. CLB Cầu lông. CLB Bóng đá. CLB Yoga. CLB Điền kinh. CLB Bơi. * Chúng tôi sẽ liên hệ qua điện thoại với những CV phù hợp trong vòng 7 ngày làm việc kể từ ngày ứng tuyển.
Job Description: * Số lượng cần tuyển: 01. * Vị trí làm việc: Phòng Kinh doanh vận tải Khối Doanh nghiệp. * Địa điểm làm việc: Tầng 11, tòa nhà Minh Long, số 17 Bà Huyện Thanh Quan, P. Võ Thị Sáu, Q.3, TP. Hồ Chí Minh. * Thời gian làm việc: 08h00 – 17h30 các ngày thứ 2 thứ 6 (nghỉ trưa từ 12h đến 13h30). MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC. Chủ động tìm kiếm, phát triển mới các Đối tác lĩnh vực Vận tải, bao gồm: Taxi, Xe liên tỉnh và các dịch vụ vận tải khác (Giao hàng, Tàu thủy,…). Duy trì và phát triển mở rộng phạm vi hợp tác với các Đối tác tiềm năng, Đối tác chiến lược. Xúc tiến ký kết hợp đồng hợp tác với Đối tác. Phối hợp nội bộ và các bên liên quan để triển khai kết nối và vận hành dịch vụ. Phối hợp với bộ phận Marketing triển khai các chương trình truyền thông, quảng bá sản phẩm, dịch vụ. Lập các báo cáo đánh giá, phân tích thị trường, dịch vụ liên quan. Các nhiệm vụ khác theo chỉ đạo của Ban lãnh đạo công ty.
